cards.name: Thunderclap
cards.text:
You may sacrifice a Mountain rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Thunderclap deals 3 damage to target creature.
cards.originalText:
You may sacrifice a mountain instead of paying Thunderclap's mana cost.
Thunderclap deals 3 damage to target creature.

cards.name: Tremor
cards.text: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
cards.flavor: Without a word, Gerrard and Sisay ran deeper into the mountain. Neither of them intended to leave Mercadia without the Weatherlight and its crew.
cards.originalText: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.

cards.name: Two-Headed Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Two-Headed Dragon can block an additional creature each combat.
{1}{R}: Two-Headed Dragon gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{1}{R}: Two-Headed Dragon gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
Two-Headed Dragon can't be blocked except by two or more creatures. It may block one additional creature. (All blocks must be legal.)

cards.name: Uphill Battle
cards.text: Creatures played by your opponents enter the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor: Cho-Manno knew he had no choice but to ally with Gerrard. If that's what it took to free his people, he'd pay the price.
cards.originalText: Creatures your opponents play come into play tapped.

cards.name: Volcanic Wind
cards.text: Volcanic Wind deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures, where X is the number of creatures on the battlefield as you cast this spell.
cards.flavor: The Cho-Arrim call it "the fury of Ramos."

rulings.text: The value of X is determined at the time you announce this spell, and you choose the targets and the division of damage among those targets as part of the announcement as well.
If there are no creatures on the battlefield when you cast this, you do not pick any targets and it deals no damage.
If there is at least one creature on the battlefield when you are announcing this, you can't choose zero targets. You must choose between 1 and X targets.

cards.originalText: Volcanic Wind deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures, where X is the number of creatures in play.

cards.name: War Cadence
cards.text: {X}{R}: This turn, creatures can't block unless their controller pays {X} for each blocking creature they control.
cards.flavor: The rhythm isn't a call to arms, but a signal that the goblins have made a new enemy.

rulings.text: You can choose X=0. This doesn't have an effect most of the time, but it does mean that creatures can't block unless the controller chooses to pay the cost (a cost of zero is not automatically paid). You can use this to make your creatures unable to block an attacker.
The ability only applies to blocks declared after it resolves. It will not add costs to any blockers already announced.

cards.originalText: {X}{R}: Creatures can't block this turn unless their controller pays {X} for each blocking creature.

cards.name: Warmonger
cards.text: {2}: Warmonger deals 1 damage to each creature without flying and each player. Any player may activate this ability.
cards.flavor: Funny how money and war travel so well together.
cards.originalText: {2}: Warmonger deals 1 damage to each creature without flying and each player. Any player may play this ability.

cards.name: Warpath
cards.text: Warpath deals 3 damage to each blocking creature and each blocked creature.
cards.flavor: Cho-Manno had never seen Mercadia City's forces fight so well. The magistrate must have hired a new hero.
cards.originalText: Warpath deals 3 damage to each blocking creature and each blocked creature.

cards.name: Wild Jhovall
cards.flavor: Jhovalls sharpen their claws on trees—or on Mercadians, if no trees are handy.

cards.name: Word of Blasting
cards.text: Destroy target Wall. It can't be regenerated. Word of Blasting deals damage equal to that Wall's converted mana cost to the Wall's controller.
cards.originalText: Destroy target Wall. It can't be regenerated. Word of Blasting deals damage equal to that Wall's converted mana cost to the Wall's controller.

cards.name: Ancestral Mask
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 for each other enchantment on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: The masks, like the ancient trees they're grown from, lend strength to the dryads.
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 for each other enchantment in play.

cards.name: Bifurcate
cards.text: Search your library for a permanent card with the same name as target nontoken creature and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a copy of target creature card in play and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Boa Constrictor
cards.text: {T}: Boa Constrictor gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Its eyes are bigger than its stomach, but its mouth is larger still.
cards.originalText: {T}: Boa Constrictor gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Briar Patch
cards.text: Whenever a creature attacks you, it gets -1/-0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: As easily as the dryads could close a fist, so could the branches and underbrush entangle.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature attacks you, it gets -1/-0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Caller of the Hunt
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, choose a creature type.
Caller of the Hunt's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures of the chosen type on the battlefield.
cards.originalText:
As you play Caller of the Hunt, choose a creature type.
Caller of the Hunt's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures in play of the chosen type.

cards.name: Caustic Wasps
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Caustic Wasps deals combat damage to a player, you may destroy target artifact that player controls.
cards.flavor: Even the wasp knows how to pay the magistrate his due respect.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Caustic Wasps deals combat damage to a player, you may destroy target artifact that player controls.

cards.name: Clear the Land
cards.text: Each player reveals the top five cards of their library, puts all land cards revealed this way onto the battlefield tapped, and exiles the rest.
cards.originalText: Each player reveals the top five cards of his or her library, puts into play tapped all land cards revealed this way, and removes the rest from the game.

cards.name: Collective Unconscious
cards.text: Draw a card for each creature you control.
cards.flavor: Gerrard knew little of Ramos, the sky god they worshiped. But he felt the power of the chant.
cards.originalText: Draw a card for each creature you control.

cards.name: Dawnstrider
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Discard a card: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
cards.flavor: Morning's mists can hide many things.
cards.originalText: {G}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

cards.name: Deadly Insect
cards.text: Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor: With his newfound sense of self-importance, Squee set his sights on ever-bigger bugs.
cards.originalText: Deadly Insect can't be the target of spells or abilities.

cards.name: Deepwood Drummer
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Discard a card: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: His drums echo Deepwood's heartbeat.
cards.originalText: {G}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Deepwood Elder
cards.text: {X}{G}{G}, {T}, Discard a card: X target lands become Forests until end of turn.
cards.flavor: They'd guarded the Henge so long that they were as attuned to the powerstones as they were to the trees.
cards.originalText: {X}{G}{G}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: X target lands become forests until end of turn.

cards.name: Deepwood Tantiv
cards.text: Whenever Deepwood Tantiv becomes blocked, you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: A single tantiv is just as dangerous as a herd.
cards.originalText: Whenever Deepwood Tantiv becomes blocked, you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Deepwood Wolverine
cards.text: Whenever Deepwood Wolverine becomes blocked, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The jhovalls are depleting its food sources, the Mercadians are eroding its home, and you're wondering why it's angry?
cards.originalText: Whenever Deepwood Wolverine becomes blocked, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Desert Twister
cards.text: Destroy target permanent.
cards.flavor: The magical dust clouds Mercadian mages use to traverse the plane generate storms that devastate the surrounding terrain. But as long as the storms don't touch the mountain, the nobles simply don't care.
cards.originalText: Destroy target permanent.

cards.name: Erithizon
cards.text: Whenever Erithizon attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature of defending player's choice.
cards.flavor: Unlike scorpions, the erithizon isn't immune to its own weaponry.

rulings.text: Erithizon's controller controls the triggered ability, but their opponent chooses the target.

cards.originalText: Whenever Erithizon attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature of defending player's choice.

cards.name: Ferocity
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature blocks or becomes blocked, you may put a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor:
"You lot go on ahead. I'll keep killing them until it sticks."
—Tahngarth
cards.originalText: Whenever enchanted creature blocks or becomes blocked, you may put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Food Chain
cards.text: Exile a creature you control: Add X mana of any one color, where X is 1 plus the exiled creature's converted mana cost. Spend this mana only to cast creature spells.

rulings.text: This mana may not be used to pay costs imposed after the spell is initially cast.
This mana may be used on additional costs to cast the spell, such as Kicker.

cards.originalText: Remove a creature you control from the game: Add X mana of any color to your mana pool, where X is the removed creature's converted mana cost plus one. This mana may be spent only to play creature spells.

cards.name: Foster
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control dies, you may pay {1}. If you do, reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a creature card. Put that card into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature you control is put into a graveyard, you may pay {1}. If you do, reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a creature card. Put that card into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.

cards.name: Game Preserve
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, each player reveals the top card of their library. If all cards revealed this way are creature cards, put those cards onto the battlefield under their owners' control.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, each player reveals the top card of his or her library. If all cards revealed this way are creature cards, put those cards into play under their owners' control. (Otherwise, put them back face-down on top of their owners' libraries.)

cards.name: Giant Caterpillar
cards.text: {G}, Sacrifice Giant Caterpillar: Create a 1/1 green Insect creature token with flying named Butterfly at the beginning of the next end step.

rulings.text: It used to make Butterfly tokens. Now it makes Insect tokens named Butterfly.

cards.originalText: {G}, Sacrifice Giant Caterpillar: Put a 1/1 green Butterfly creature token with flying into play at end of turn.

cards.name: Groundskeeper
cards.text: {1}{G}: Return target basic land card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Whereas the rebels fight to defend the land, they work to renew it.
cards.originalText: {1}{G}: Return target basic land card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Horned Troll
cards.text: {G}: Regenerate Horned Troll.
cards.flavor:
"If I says it's a troll, it's a troll. Goblins is always right in Mercadia."
—Squee
cards.originalText: {G}: Regenerate Horned Troll.

cards.name: Howling Wolf
cards.text: When Howling Wolf enters the battlefield, you may search your library for up to three cards named Howling Wolf, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
cards.originalText: When Howling Wolf comes into play, you may search your library for up to three Howling Wolf cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

cards.name: Hunted Wumpus
cards.text: When Hunted Wumpus enters the battlefield, each other player may put a creature card from their hand onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Just one can feed a dozen people for a month.
cards.originalText: When Hunted Wumpus comes into play, each other player may put a creature card from his or her hand into play under his or her control.

cards.name: Invigorate
cards.text:
If you control a Forest, rather than pay this spell's mana cost, you may have an opponent gain 3 life.
Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.

rulings.text: If another effect causes Invigorate to cost more, you must pay that additional cost even if you pay its alternative cost.

If an effect says that an opponent can't gain life, you can't have that player gain life to pay Invigorate's alternative cost. If an effect instead replaces life gain, such as that of Sulfuric Vortex, you may choose to pay the cost even though the cost's action is replaced with nothing.

cards.originalText:
If you control a forest, you may have an opponent gain 3 life instead of paying Invigorate's mana cost.
Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.

cards.name: Land Grant
cards.text:
If you have no land cards in hand, you may reveal your hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Search your library for a Forest card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: You can pay the "reveal your hand" cost even if your hand is already revealed due to another effect.
Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText:
If you have no land cards in hand, you may reveal your hand instead of paying Land Grant's mana cost.
Search your library for a forest card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Ley Line
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may put a +1/+1 counter on target creature of their choice.
cards.flavor:
"I can feel the strength of the entire forest."
—Gerrard
cards.originalText: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

cards.name: Lumbering Satyr
cards.text: All creatures have forestwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor:
The satyr carves the path that all of Rushwood follows.
—Cho-Arrim saying
cards.originalText: All creatures gain forestwalk. (They're unblockable as long as defending player controls a forest.)

cards.name: Lure
cards.text:
Enchant creature
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.
cards.flavor: Deepwood's reach is not long, so it invites its enemies in.

rulings.text: Lure doesn't give any creatures the ability to block the target creature. It just forces those creatures that are already able to block the creature to do so.

As blockers are declared, any creature that's tapped or affected by a spell or ability that says it can't block doesn't block. If there's a cost associated with having the creature block, no player is forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't block if that cost isn't paid.

cards.originalText: All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so if able.

cards.name: Megatherium
cards.text:
Trample
When Megatherium enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you pay {1} for each card in your hand.
cards.originalText:
Trample
When Megatherium comes into play, sacrifice it unless you pay {1} for each card in your hand.

cards.name: Natural Affinity
cards.text: All lands become 2/2 creatures until end of turn. They're still lands.
cards.flavor: As long as the dryads are a part of the forest, the forest is a part of the army.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: All lands become 2/2 creatures until end of turn. They still count as lands.

cards.name: Pangosaur
cards.text: Whenever a player plays a land, return Pangosaur to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Only Rushwood is vast enough to swallow this creature whole.
cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a land, return Pangosaur to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Revive
cards.text: Return target green card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Gerrard's heart ached, recalling the living wreath Mirri laid for her dead kin. No such memorial was left for her in Rath.
cards.originalText: Return target green card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Rushwood Dryad
cards.text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor: Rushwood is a living jewel that reflects its dwellers' hearts.
cards.originalText: Forestwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a forest.)

cards.name: Rushwood Elemental
cards.text:
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Rushwood Elemental.
cards.originalText:
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Rushwood Elemental.

cards.name: Rushwood Herbalist
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Discard a card: Regenerate target creature.
cards.flavor: When generals gather their armies, healers gather their herbs.
cards.originalText: {G}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Regenerate target creature.

cards.name: Rushwood Legate
cards.text: If an opponent controls an Island and you control a Forest, you may cast this spell without paying its mana cost.
cards.originalText: If an opponent controls an island and you control a forest, you may play Rushwood Legate without paying its mana cost.

cards.name: Saber Ants
cards.text: Whenever Saber Ants is dealt damage, you may create that many 1/1 green Insect creature tokens.
cards.flavor: They stay on the battlefield only long enough to consume the losers.
cards.originalText: Whenever Saber Ants is dealt damage, you may put that many 1/1 green Insect creature tokens into play.

cards.name: Sacred Prey
cards.text: Whenever Sacred Prey becomes blocked, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: To see one is a good omen to the Cho-Arrim.
cards.originalText: When Sacred Prey becomes blocked, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Silverglade Elemental
cards.text: When Silverglade Elemental enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. If you do, shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: When Silverglade Elemental comes into play, you may search your library for a forest card and put that card into play. If you do, shuffle your library.

cards.name: Silverglade Pathfinder
cards.text: {1}{G}, {T}, Discard a card: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: {1}{G}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card into play tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Snake Pit
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a blue or black spell, you may create a 1/1 green Snake creature token.
cards.flavor:
If the ground is smooth, the way will be rough.
—Deepwood saying
cards.originalText: Whenever an opponent plays a blue or black spell, you may put a 1/1 green Snake creature token into play.

cards.name: Snorting Gahr
cards.text: Whenever Snorting Gahr becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: There's little advantage to surprising the gahr.
cards.originalText: Whenever Snorting Gahr becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Spidersilk Armor
cards.text: Creatures you control get +0/+1 and have reach. (They can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: It hardly weighs anything, but it takes all day to remove.
cards.originalText: Creatures you control get +0/+1 and may block as though they had flying.

cards.name: Spontaneous Generation
cards.text: Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token for each card in your hand.
cards.flavor: Saprolings always thrive on the ruins of others, and Mercadia ruins more than most.
cards.originalText: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token into play for each card in your hand.

cards.name: Squall
cards.text: Squall deals 2 damage to each creature with flying.
cards.flavor: The air that holds them aloft can just as easily put them down.
cards.originalText: Squall deals 2 damage to each creature with flying.

cards.name: Squallmonger
cards.text: {2}: Squallmonger deals 1 damage to each creature with flying and each player. Any player may activate this ability.
cards.flavor: "Squall, gale, hurricane—it's all a matter of size . . . and price."
cards.originalText: {2}: Squallmonger deals 1 damage to each creature with flying and each player. Any player may play this ability.

cards.name: Stamina
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has vigilance.
Sacrifice Stamina: Regenerate enchanted creature.
cards.originalText:
Attacking doesn't cause enchanted creature to tap.
Sacrifice Stamina: Regenerate enchanted creature.

cards.name: Sustenance
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice a land: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Like the dryads, the forest itself willingly gives up some of its life for the sake of the future.
cards.originalText: {1}, Sacrifice a land: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Tiger Claws
cards.text:
Flash
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has trample.
cards.flavor: Cho-Arrim martial artists emulate the beasts of their home.
cards.originalText:
You may play Tiger Claws any time you could play an instant.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has trample.

cards.name: Tranquility
cards.text: Destroy all enchantments.
cards.flavor: Sisay had been restored to her place on the ship, the Legacy had been recovered, and the Weatherlight was sailing home to Dominaria. Gerrard focused on the debts he'd settled . . . and on those he'd soon collect.
cards.originalText: Destroy all enchantments.

cards.name: Venomous Breath
cards.text: Choose target creature. At this turn's next end of combat, destroy all creatures that blocked or were blocked by it this turn.
cards.flavor: The dryads need neither size nor strength to defeat their enemies in battle.

rulings.text: It affects creatures that had blocked the target when this spell resolves, even if they are no longer blocking the creature.

cards.originalText: At end of combat, destroy all creatures that blocked or were blocked by target creature this turn.

cards.name: Venomous Dragonfly
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Venomous Dragonfly blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
cards.flavor: A pretty little death is still death.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Venomous Dragonfly blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

cards.name: Vernal Equinox
cards.text: Any player may cast creature and enchantment spells as though they had flash.
cards.originalText: Any player may play creature and enchantment spells any time he or she could play an instant.

cards.name: Vine Dryad
cards.text:
You may exile a green card from your hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Flash
Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.originalText:
Forestwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a forest.)
You may play Vine Dryad any time you could play an instant.
You may remove a green card in your hand from the game instead of paying Vine Dryad's mana cost.

cards.name: Vine Trellis
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{T}: Add {G}.
cards.flavor: "We protect our own with our own."
cards.originalText:
(Walls can't attack.)
{T}: Add one green mana to your mana pool.

cards.name: Assembly Hall
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Reveal a creature card in your hand. Search your library for a card with the same name as that card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: You do not have to find a card if you do not want to.

cards.originalText: {4}, {T}: Reveal a creature card in your hand, search your library for a copy of that card, and put the card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Barbed Wire
cards.text:
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Barbed Wire deals 1 damage to that player.
{2}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt by Barbed Wire this turn.
cards.flavor: A steel snake with ten thousand teeth.
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Barbed Wire deals 1 damage to that player.
{2}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt by Barbed Wire this turn.

cards.name: Bargaining Table
cards.text: {X}, {T}: Draw a card. X is the number of cards in an opponent's hand.
cards.flavor: Although it looks like a game, business around the table is deadly serious.

rulings.text: You choose an opponent on announcement. This is not targeted, but a choice is still made. This choice is made before determining the value for X that is used in the cost.

cards.originalText: {X}, {T}: Draw a card. X is the number of cards in an opponent's hand.

cards.name: Credit Voucher
cards.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Credit Voucher: Shuffle any number of cards from your hand into your library, then draw that many cards.
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Credit Voucher: Shuffle any number of cards from your hand into your library, then draw that many cards.

cards.name: Crenellated Wall
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{T}: Target creature gets +0/+4 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Mercadian soldiers excel at finding things to stand behind.
cards.originalText:
(Walls can't attack.)
{T}: Target creature gets +0/+4 until end of turn.

cards.name: Crooked Scales
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, destroy target creature an opponent controls. If you lose the flip, destroy target creature you control unless you pay {3} and repeat this process.

rulings.text: If you pay the {3}, you do not choose a new pair of targets when it repeats. This means that if you lose the flip, you have the choice of having your creature destroyed or paying {3} to try again to win the flip. If you lose again, you get the same choice, and so on. You can keep trying to destroy your opponent's creature as long as you have mana to pay.
You choose both targets on activation, so you can only activate this when you can legally choose both targets.

cards.originalText: {4}, {T}: Choose target creature you control and target creature an opponent controls. Flip a coin. If you win the flip, destroy the creature the opponent controls. If you lose the flip, destroy the creature you control unless you pay {3} and reflip the coin.

cards.name: Crumbling Sanctuary
cards.text: If damage would be dealt to a player, that player exiles that many cards from the top of their library instead.

rulings.text: If you have no cards in your library, then damage done to you will have no effect since it will get changed into a removal that can't happen.
The ability affects all players.

cards.originalText: For each 1 damage that would be dealt to a player, that player removes the top card of his or her library from the game instead.

cards.name: Distorting Lens
cards.text: {T}: Target permanent becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The magistrate seems to prefer a distorted perspective of reality.
cards.originalText: {T}: Target permanent becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.

cards.name: Eye of Ramos
cards.text:
{T}: Add {U}.
Sacrifice Eye of Ramos: Add {U}.
cards.flavor: Ramos wept, and there were seas.

rulings.text: You can activate the sacrifice ability while this card is tapped.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add one blue mana to your mana pool. 
Sacrifice Eye of Ramos: Add one blue mana to your mana pool.

cards.name: General's Regalia
cards.text: {3}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, that damage is dealt to target creature you control instead.
cards.flavor: A uniform fit for a goblin.
cards.originalText: {3}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, that damage is dealt to target creature you control instead.

cards.name: Heart of Ramos
cards.text:
{T}: Add {R}.
Sacrifice Heart of Ramos: Add {R}.
cards.flavor: Ramos bled, and there was fire.

rulings.text: You can activate the sacrifice ability while this card is tapped.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add one red mana to your mana pool. 
Sacrifice Heart of Ramos: Add one red mana to your mana pool.

cards.name: Henge Guardian
cards.text: {2}: Henge Guardian gains trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Like so many Thran relics, the wurm engine kept operating long after its creators were gone.
cards.originalText: {2}: Henge Guardian gains trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Horn of Plenty
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a spell, they may pay {1}. If the player does, they draw a card at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor:
"This horn is an exact replica of the fabled Horn of Ramos, except mine is more lavish."
—Mercadian magistrate
cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a spell, he or she may pay {1}. If that player does, he or she draws a card at end of turn.

cards.name: Horn of Ramos
cards.text:
{T}: Add {G}.
Sacrifice Horn of Ramos: Add {G}.
cards.flavor: Ramos touched, and there was life.

rulings.text: You can activate the sacrifice ability while this card is tapped.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add one green mana to your mana pool.
Sacrifice Horn of Ramos: Add one green mana to your mana pool.

cards.name: Iron Lance
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The only way to get Mercadians to fight on the front lines is to give them really long weapons."
—Gerrard
cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Jeweled Torque
cards.text:
As Jeweled Torque enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Whenever a player casts a spell of the chosen color, you may pay {2}. If you do, you gain 2 life.
cards.originalText:
As Jeweled Torque comes into play, choose a color.
Whenever a player plays a spell of the chosen color, you may pay {2}. If you do, you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Kyren Archive
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may exile the top card of your library face down.
{5}, Discard your hand, Sacrifice Kyren Archive: Put all cards exiled with Kyren Archive into their owner's hand.
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may remove the top card of your library from the game face down.
{5}, Discard your hand, Sacrifice Kyren Archive: Put all cards removed from the game with Kyren Archive into their owner's hand.

cards.name: Kyren Toy
cards.text:
{1}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Kyren Toy.
{T}, Remove X charge counters from Kyren Toy: Add an amount of {C} equal to X plus one.
cards.originalText:
{1}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Kyren Toy.
{T}, Remove X charge counters from Kyren Toy: Add X plus one colorless mana to your mana pool.

cards.name: Magistrate's Scepter
cards.text:
{4}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Magistrate's Scepter.
{T}, Remove three charge counters from Magistrate's Scepter: Take an extra turn after this one.

rulings.text: If multiple extra turns would be taken after this one, perhaps because more than one player has activated the last ability of their Magistrate's Scepter, the most recently created one is taken first.

cards.originalText:
{4}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Magistrate's Scepter.
{T}, Remove three charge counters from Magistrate's Scepter: Take another turn after this one.

cards.name: Mercadian Atlas
cards.text: At the beginning of your end step, if you didn't play a land this turn, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: One may as well chart the clouds as try to map Mercadia.

rulings.text: It only checks if you played a land. Putting a land onto the battlefield by using an effect of another card does not count as "playing a land".

cards.originalText: At the end of your turn, if you didn't play a land this turn, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Mercadian Lift
cards.text:
{1}, {T}: Put a winch counter on Mercadian Lift.
{T}, Remove X winch counters from Mercadian Lift: You may put a creature card with converted mana cost X from your hand onto the battlefield.

rulings.text: Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional. When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.

cards.originalText:
{1}, {T}: Put a winch counter on Mercadian Lift.
{T}, Remove X winch counters from Mercadian Lift: Put a creature card with converted mana cost X from your hand into play.

cards.name: Monkey Cage
cards.text: When a creature enters the battlefield, sacrifice Monkey Cage and create X 2/2 green Monkey creature tokens, where X is that creature's converted mana cost.
cards.originalText: When a creature comes into play, sacrifice Monkey Cage and put into play a number of 2/2 green Ape creature tokens equal to that creature's converted mana cost.

cards.name: Panacea
cards.text: {X}{X}, {T}: Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.flavor: A drop numbs the tongue. A sip sends the heart racing. A draught reforges the body.
cards.originalText: {X}{X}, {T}: Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.name: Power Matrix
cards.text: {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains flying, first strike, and trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor: As he repaired the ship's planeswalking engine, Karn saw for the first time how he could catalyze the Weatherlight's evolution.
cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains flying, first strike, and trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Puffer Extract
cards.text: {X}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +X/+X until end of turn. Destroy it at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: The puffer's flesh is the deadliest in the sea—and therefore the most useful.
cards.originalText: {X}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +X/+X until end of turn. Destroy it at end of turn.

cards.name: Rishadan Pawnshop
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Shuffle target nontoken permanent you control into its owner's library.
cards.flavor: Everything comes to the waterfront eventually, on the tide or on credit.
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Shuffle target card in play you control into its owner's library.

cards.name: Skull of Ramos
cards.text:
{T}: Add {B}.
Sacrifice Skull of Ramos: Add {B}.
cards.flavor: Ramos fell, and there was night.

rulings.text: You can activate the sacrifice ability while this card is tapped.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add one black mana to your mana pool. 
Sacrifice Skull of Ramos: Add one black mana to your mana pool.

cards.name: Tooth of Ramos
cards.text:
{T}: Add {W}.
Sacrifice Tooth of Ramos: Add {W}.
cards.flavor: Ramos smiled, and there was day.

rulings.text: You can activate the sacrifice ability while this card is tapped.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add one white mana to your mana pool. 
Sacrifice Tooth of Ramos: Add one white mana to your mana pool.

cards.name: Toymaker
cards.text: {1}, {T}, Discard a card: Target noncreature artifact becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost until end of turn. (It retains its abilities.)

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: {1}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Target noncreature artifact becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost until end of turn. (It retains its abilities.)

cards.name: Worry Beads
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player puts the top card of their library into their graveyard.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Dust Bowl
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{3}, {T}, Sacrifice a land: Destroy target nonbasic land.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool.
{3}, {T}, Sacrifice a land: Destroy target nonbasic land.

cards.name: Fountain of Cho
cards.text:
Fountain of Cho enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Put a storage counter on Fountain of Cho.
{T}, Remove any number of storage counters from Fountain of Cho: Add {W} for each storage counter removed this way.
cards.originalText:
Fountain of Cho comes into play tapped.
{T}: Put a storage counter on Fountain of Cho.
{T}, Remove any number of storage counters from Fountain of Cho: Add one white mana to your mana pool for each storage counter removed this way.

cards.name: Henge of Ramos
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{2}, {T}: Add one mana of any color.
cards.flavor:
It is the hub. We are the wheel.
—Dryad saying
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool.
{2}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
